items.value: Complete the first 4 levels to unlock Win customization.
Tooltip button in the control panel
Show tutorial to level only 1 time
Click on the right or left side of the panel to move
Are you sure you want to exit the game?
Objective: to get to the exit
Hello! My name is Win, can you help me get to the exit?
Below there is a <color=red>control panel</color> where you can start and stop the program. Also, just below there is a <color=red>terminal</color> where you need to enter commands.
I see, but what to write there?

Use the corresponding commands: <color=red><right></color>, <color=red><left></color>, <color=red><up></color> and <color=red><down></color> to control me. There is a <color=red>joystick</color> button in the control panel (CP), with which you can also control me, but its charge is only enough for a few levels
On the left above the control panel, there is a button to open a prompt.
A little lower is the button for additional functions, where you can return to the menu, reload the level or open the full manual
We are already at the next level and I already see the <color=red>microchip</color>! This is a valuable resource with which you can add new abilities to me! But there are obstacles...
I need to control more carefully

In addition to simple commands, you can create constructions. To create it, you must first declare the type of construction (<color=red>if</color>). Next, in parentheses, you need to write <color=red>construction condition</color>: first, the direction is set (<color=red><right>, <left>, <above></color> or <color=red><below></color>), then object(<color=red><obstacle></color>).

After creating a construction, you can write commands in it, which will be executed only if the condition is met. To mark the end of the construction, after you have written everything you need inside, you need to write the command <color=red><end></color>.

This robot does not look friendly, it is better not to get close to it. To do this, you can enter the object <color=red><enemy></color> in the construction condition, instead of <color=red><obstacle></color>

Also, if an enemy robot is blocking the path, then I can attack it with the <color=red><attack></color> command and then you need to specify the direction where to hit or attack with the attack button on the joystick. To use attack functions, you need to create the stun gun in the section <color=red><<Improvements>></color>. Command example: <color=orange>attack right</color>

It's time to learn what loops are. You have already seen how many commands are repeated in the code and how the joystick simplifies it all, but soon the charge will end. The construction <color=red><while></color> should also be explored in the <color=red><<Improvements>></color>

The <color=red><while></color> construction type is a loop that runs until the condition is satisfied.
Same as with the <color=red>if</color> construction, only this construction can execute commands several times
Example #1:
<color=orange>while (above obstacle)
right
end</color>

You can also write a construction that will execute commands indefinitely. To do this, enter <color=red><robot enabled></color> in the condition.
Example #2:
<color=orange>while (robot enabled)
right
end</color>

In the conditions of constructions, you can write a negative condition. That is, instead of, for example, <color=red><if (left obstacle)></color>, you can write <color=red><if (left no obstacle)></color>. And the robot, in this case, will instead check for the presence of an obstacle on the left, on the contrary, check for its absence

You can also create constructions with multiple conditions using the special character <color=red><&></color>. It can be used to combine an infinite number of conditions.
Example #1:
<color=orange>if (left obstacle&right no obstacle)
right
down
end
</color>

Using these functions, you can flexibly set conditions for constructions. Oh, and yes, the joystick is out of charge, it's time to write the code manually (if you forgot something from the past, refer to <color=red><Manual></color>)
We got out of the factory and got into some kind of garden. There are hostile robots here too, can you handle it?
Wow, how spacious there. The control panel blocks the whole view! Click on the button in the right corner of the CP to hide the terminal
The map just got bigger! Swipe your finger across the screen to navigate the map.
Error found: object <{0}> in condition on line ({1}), does not exist. Perhaps you meant object <obstacle> or <enemy>
Error found: condition on line ({0}) is malformed
The construction on the line ({0}) has no algorithmic connection with the previous construction
Error found: command <{0}> on line ({1}) does not exist. If you have difficulty, please refer to the <Manual>

When executing the code, Win crashed into an obstacle. You can create an <if (<direction> obstacle)> construction and a code block in it to avoid the obstacle. Don't forget to add <end> at the end of the construction. For more information, please refer to the <Manual>
The program was successfully completed, but the final goal was not achieved
Command or construction not learned. Go to the menu in the <Improvements> tab to learn the corresponding tool
